revisions.rev:
'''Anne Golden "Annie" Bersagel''' ( March 30, 1983) was the 2006 [[NCAA Woman of the Year Award]] winner, in recognition of excellence in academics, athletics, community service and leadership as well as the 2006 [[Walter Byers Award]] winner as the top [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]] female scholar-athlete.<ref name=WB06>{{cite web|url=http://www2.ncaa.org/portal/media_and_events/press_room/2006/may/20060511_byers_rls.html|title=Two Track and Field Student-Athletes Earn NCAA's Highest Academic Award|accessdate=2008-01-25|publisher=The [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]]|date=2006-05-11}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ncaasports.com/track-and-field/story/9762116|title=Anne Bersagel NCAA Woman of the Year|publisher=The [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]]|accessdate=2008-01-25|date=2006-10-28 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20071117081016/http://www.ncaasports.com/track-and-field/story/9762116 <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2007-11-17}}</ref> Bersagel also earned a [[Fulbright Scholar]]ship.<ref name=WOY>{{cite web|url=http://www.ncaa.org/wps/portal/!ut/p/kcxml/04_Sj9SPykssy0xPLMnMz0vM0Y_QjzKLN4g3NPUESYGYxqb6kWhCjhgihqYeCDFfj_zcVKBMpDlQwCgkWD8qJzU9MblSP1jfWz9AvyA3NDSiPN8RANQz8cc!/delta/base64xml/L3dJdyEvd0ZNQUFzQUsvNElVRS82XzBfMTVL?WCM_GLOBAL_CONTEXT=/wps/wcm/connect/NCAA/NCAA+News/NCAA+News+Online/2006/Association-wide/Woman+of+the+Year+winner+finds+meaning+in+journey+-+11-6-06+NCAA+News| title= Woman of the Year winner finds meaning in journey|accessdate=2008-01-27|publisher=National Collegiate Athletic Association|date=2006-11-06|author=McKindra, Leilana}}</ref>
Bersagel, a [[Greeley, Colorado]] native who attended [[Greeley Central High School]],<ref name=Gtrib>{{cite web|url=http://www.greeleytrib.com/article/20060707/SPORTS/107070078|title=Runner goes the distance|accessdate=2008-01-27|publisher=Greeley Publishing Co.|work=greeleytrib.com|date=2006-07-06|author=Fernandez, Bobby}}</ref> is a three-time [[All-America]]n in [[cross country running|cross country]], a two-time Academic All-American, a two-time [[Wake Forest University]] scholar-athlete of the year, five-time [[track & field]] All-American, a two-time [[Atlantic Coast Conference]] (ACC) champion in the outdoor [[10000 metres|10,000 meters]], and was the 2005 ACC champion in the indoor [[5000 meters]].<ref name=WB06/>
After graduating with honors as an [[economics]] and [[politics]] double major in December 2005, she continued to train for with Team USA Minnesota based in [[Minneapolis-St. Paul, Minnesota]].<ref name=WOY/> She joined Team USA immediately after graduating.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usatf.org/news/view.aspx?DUID=USATF_2006_01_31_12_53_53|title=Team USA named for Yokohama International Women's Ekiden|accessdate=2008-01-27|publisher=USA Track & Field, Inc.}}</ref> She then won the USA [[Half-Marathon]] champions held in [[Kansas City, Missouri]] on June 3, 2006 with a time of 1 hour 14 minutes 36 seconds to earn [[United States dollar|$]]5000 in prize money.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ontherunevents.com/news/runningusawire/0396.htm|title= Sell, Bersagel to Defend USA Half-Marathon Titles in Houston |accessdate=2008-01-27|publisher=ontherunevents.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.time-to-run.us/news/2006/june/040606.htm|title=Bersagel Wins USA Women's Half-Marathon Title in KC|accessdate=2008-01-27|publisher= Time-to-Run}}</ref>
She also placed 10th in the 2006 USA Cross Country Championships 8 km. However, in May 2007 she left the training group to complete her [[master's degree]] in peace and conflict instead of returning to the [[University of Minnesota]] to complete her degree.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://downthebackstretch.blogspot.com/2007/05/bersagel-leaving-team-usa-minnesota-to.html|title=Bersagel Leaving Team USA Minnesota; Will Continue Graduate Study in Oslo|accessdate=2008-01-27|date=2007-05-08}}</ref> Bersagel earned a Fulbright Scholarship to pursue a graduate degree in peace and conflict studies at the [[University of Oslo]]. Bersagel has [[intern]]ed at the [[U.S. Embassy]] in [[Oslo, Norway]] and has a goal of becoming the [[U.S. Secretary of State]] where she can enrich the lives of others.<ref name=WOY/> She has also been awarded a NCAA postgraduate scholarship.
Although she had hoped to appear in the Olympic Track & Field Trials that were held June 27–July 6, 2008 in [[Eugene, Oregon]],<ref name=Gtrib/> she did not.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usatf.org/events/2008/OlympicTrials-TF/results/P12.asp|title=Women 5000 Meter Run|accessdate=2008-07-11|date=2008-06-30|publisher=USA Track & Field, Inc.}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usatf.org/events/2008/OlympicTrials-TF/results/F14.asp|title=Women 10000 Meter Run|accessdate=2008-07-11|date=2008-06-27|publisher=USA Track & Field, Inc.}}</ref>
She also did not enter the Women's Marathon Olympic Trials on April 20, 2008 in [[Boston, Massachusetts]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usatf.org/events/2008/OlympicTrials-Marathon-Women/results.asp|title=2008 U.S. Olympic Team Trials - Women's Marathon |accessdate=2008-07-11|date=2008-04-20|publisher=USA Track & Field, Inc.}}</ref>
She represented the [[United_States_at_the_2011_Pan_American_Games#Athletics|United State]] during the [[2011 Pan American Games]] for the [[Athletics at the 2011 Pan American Games â Women's 10,000 metres|10,000m]] in Guadalajara, Mexico with a 4th place finish as the top American in 35:23.31. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://info.guadalajara2011.org.mx/ENG/AT/ATR173A_ATW10010050000001ENG.htm|title=2011 Pan Am Games|accessdate=2011-10-30|date=2011-10-30|publisher=Pan Am Games}}</ref>
